Add: ufo_filter_get_input_queue_by_name()

This is necessary so that the multiplexer can combine multiple inputs.

Let resource manager handle buffer ids

Up to now, buffer ids were (hopefully) set by the source filter.
However, for correct re-ordering a unique and monotonely increasing id
has to be attached on all occasions. Therefore

- ufo_resource_manager_request_buffer() assigns a valid and increasing
  id
- ufo_buffer_increment_id() increases the id in safe way but not
  necessarily to id+1 by calling ufo_resource_manager_get_new_id()
- ufo_resource_manager_get_new_id() is a thread-safe function that
  returns the next valid id
Add: copy mode to demux filter
Implement two different copy modes for demux

Use a saner approach for managing queues

This new approach has the side effect that whenever an input or output is not
correctly connected, the computation might crash depending on how gracefully a
filter handles this situation. Fix coming soon.

Add: UfoChannel instead of GAsyncQueue

This simplifies writing filters a bit. There are no special buffers to mark the
end of computation anymore, instead a ufo_channel_pop() returns NULL if no more
data is available. Likewise, you don't have to send a special buffer but just
complete sending data with ufo_channel_finish(output_channel).

The UfoChannel abstraction is also a good entry point for future additions like
easily exchanging GAsyncQueue with something more powerful.

Add: complex arithmetic filter (add, mul, div)

Takes two input channels on "input1" and "input2" and calculates the complex
operation as specified with property "operation" using both inputs.
Remove histogram filter which was kind of useless

Add: ufo_resource_manager_memdup()

This creates a new OpenCL buffer and copies the data on-GPU without transfering
the data back to CPU.
Copy buffer content according to current state

Remove 'finished' property from UfoBuffer

This became redundant after our new channel-based buffer distribution.
Fix: queue insertion and memory freeing

Add: ufo_resource_manager_memcpy()

Now, buffer copies should work all the time

Define vendor when building OpenCL kernels

The vendor pre-processor macro can be used to write hardware-dependent OpenCL
kernels. In a .cl file an #ifdef VENDOR can be used for that. Currently, "AMD"
and "NVIDIA" are checked for.

Use clEnqueueCopyBuffer instead of kernel

Until now, a homebrewn copy kernel was used to transfer data from one GPU buffer
to another, because in the online reference list there is no such function.
However, there seem to be one [1], but it's just not linked in the table.

[1] http://www.khronos.org/registry/cl/sdk/1.0/docs/man/xhtml/clEnqueueCopyBuffer.html

2) openSUSE does not know about the OpenCL installation and therefore complains

Create new kernel instead of re-using old one

This change is necessary because setting the kernel arguments is _not_
thread-safe. Therefore, each filter requesting a kernel with
ufo_resource_manager_get_kernel() receives a new instance instead of getting an
old one.

Moreover, ufo_resource_manager_add_program() has been removed and is now merged
with ufo_resource_manager_get_kernel().

Use the common channel naming scheme

Decouple iteration and computation

This is the first in a series of patches that finally add mixed, heterogenous
computation to the UFO framework. For this, we now have kernel-style computation
on a filter. That means the process function is called for each work item, that
is composed of all inputs rather than having the filter iterating over the data
stream. As a bonus, writing filters becomes a tad more easier and needs less
code.

However, we can monkey patch the UfoFilter at a later stage and provide

Fix #99: don't unref profiler when not set

Fix #98: Use simpler, more reliable approach

Connections are now truly managed by the graph with an array of one-to-one
connections. This really simplifies JSON and scheduling a lot.

Add clprof tool

clprof is a tool to analyse and visualize (rubbishly right now) the profiling

Fix #102: gracefully return errors

Also added several unit tests for JSON handling and fixed errors that became

Add UfoConfigurable and UfoConfiguration

Non-parametric, session specific configuration is now encapsulated in a
UfoConfiguration object rather than in parameters (such as "paths") scattered
around different objects. All objects that want to be configured must implement
the UfoConfigurable interface. This is currently the case for UfoGraph,
UfoPluginManager, UfoBaseScheduler and UfoResourceManager.

Besides a cleaner design, this approach drastically enhances object decoupling.
UfoGraph does not have a reference to UfoResourceManager anymore thus we can
test UfoGraph without creating a UfoResourceManager instance. This reduces test
time considerably especially on machines with a lot of GPUs.
Install help files for new classes
Install help files for new classes

Merge branch 'master' of ufo.kit.edu:ufo-core

Conflicts:
	src/CMakeLists.txt

Add gtkdoc-scangobj support

This enriches the reference with inheritance graphs, property lists and
implemented interfaces information.

Fix: installation of HTML files

Apparently, using gtkdoc-scangobj removes the `Ufo-` prefixes from GtkDoc HTML
files. Thus, on installation the wrong files were tried to be copied.

Do not reference ufo-aux.h in public headers

ufo-aux.h is private and not installed. Therefore it must only be included in C
modules.
Add methods to get related filters from a graph

Let the scheduler execute the graph not vice versa

Up to now, the UfoGraph object had a method `run' which was used to start the
computation. Internally this object created a scheduler object and passed the
list of filters to it. However, in reality the graph does not need to know
anything about executing as it is purely a representation of data flow.

Hence, the UfoBaseScheduler now has a `run' method that takes two arguments, a
UfoGraph object and a GError location. Moreover, UfoGraph does not have a
"configuration" property anymore as it does not query path information.
Do not access configuration if NULL

Rename UfoBaseScheduler to UfoScheduler

Renamed because the Base prefix does not add any valuable information.
Set filter command queue instead of parameter

Add ufo_graph_get_roots()

This method returns all source nodes.

Rename successor and predecessor

Clearer and less prone to wrong spelling

Adapt number of buffers

The number of children is used as a metric to determine the number of allocated
output buffers.
Add timing operations to profiler object
Move starting thread out of the loop
Fix #110: Import matplotlib only if available

Fix #127: Create empty paths array

The paths_array variable is accessed even if the "paths" property has not been
set before. This leads to a segfault.

Replace argparse with optparse

Fixes #128. Python < 2.7 (e.g. CentOS, SL) does not provide argparse, so we go
back to the deprecated optparse module.

Add sink and source filters with direct input

Using UfoFilter[Sink|Source]Direct, a developer can push arbitrary data into the
computation pipeline. This commit adds them and adapts buffers to be copied.

Fix segfault when returning config paths

Despite the documentation description, the paths array is _not_ NULL-terminated
and causes havoc on release builds.
Add new IO profiler level and timer

Cleanup scheduler and output stats only on demand

Profile CPU usage

This has a caveat though, especially for the FFT and IFFT filters. Because they
wait explicitly on preceding data they essentially block inside the node thus it
looks like they spent that amount of time. We can fix this later on by
subtracting the SYNC time from them but it is hard to know which filter behaves
like that.

Fix #144: Disable mkfilter comments with -d switch

This pulls in a Jinja2 dependency which is packaged with at least Ubuntu 10.10.
Move path initialization to config object
Load from default paths if not set by any
Use updated gtester.xml by Mihael Koep
Re-implement data duplication for multiple sinks

Prevent finishing channel to early

In a multi output setup with copy mode enabled, the source cannot stop all its
children, because we have to wait until all data has been passed down through
the daisy chain. To circumvent this, the source just calls ufo_channel_finish()
on its output channel (the first of the chain), whereas all sink filters call
ufo_channel_finish_next() to pass down this information.

Unfortunately, this brings in less cohesion and tighter dependencies between
scheduling and channel management.
Do not install .pc file into different libdir

Let splitter split data stream into chunks

Now, the splitter has a "counts" integer array property that specifies into how
many sub-streams the data will be split and how many items are transfered into
each output. Therefore, counts[i] specifies the number of items a filter
connected to output i will receive. A negative number denotes that all remaining
items should be forwared to that specific output.
Turn stdout messages into proper warnings

Add ufo_graph_get_predecessors

For this, I rewrote most of the core logic of the graph and removed the
adjacency hash map. This was probably a bit faster but much more complicated and
error prone. Moreover, most graph operations happen before actual execution and
won't have a deep impact on performance.
Fix task splitting for diverging branches

Add broadcast mechanism

The broadcast send pattern is used to replicate data and transfer it to _all_
connected nodes:

   producer.set_send_pattern(Ufo.SendPattern.BROADCAST)
   g.connect_nodes(producer, consumer1)
   g.connect_nodes(producer, consumer2)

Both consumers will receive the exact same data contrary to the default mode of
SCATTER in which data is distributed fairly among connected nodes.

Don't map GPUs more than once

In a multi-rooted graph, the mapper traverses from each root in a depth-first
manner and assigns one of the GPUs. This commit fixes two things: 1) the GPU
index went out of bounds but it wasn't noticed because each node was visited
multiple times. 2) A GPU is only assigned once to a visited node and subsequent
visits are ignored.

Fix wrong path removal

Paths were removed although no node has been visited before. This was most
likely because the function name was confusing. This is now less confusingly
called unvisited_paths().

Revert "Add ufo_graph_get_predecessors"

This reverts commit 39cd24d420783358f1d4dc4902e0d6eeeaa1045a.

For some reason, this commit breaks workflows where a single data item is
processed.

Do not consider head and tail when removing paths

This is problematic when a path is longer but rejected because it's head is
already visited as part of the tail of a shorter path.

Allow a single ufo/ufo.h header only

From a user perspective it is simpler to remember to include ufo/ufo.h. This is
also more future-proof if header file names or dependencies change.
Move src -> ufo to allow ufo/foo.h inclusion

Reverse order of default paths

Therefore, we favor the installation path over the guessed paths.

The architecture graph and the resources object is created by the scheduler
rather than the user now.

Fix #171: remove dummy task from graph

On the master node a dummy task must be inserted if only one node is to be
executed remotely, otherwise we wouldn't have a serializable graph. On the
remote node, we have to remove it again otherwise execution will be stuck.

Add remote partitioning scheme

In this scheme the entire task graph is replicated on the remotes and executed.

has the caveat that the generator nodes must be finite.

Fix timestamp readout

The timestamps are bogus if the event is still in flight and if the command
queue is not the one that the event was created with. Thus, this fixes problems
with wrong values and multi GPU setups.

Allow concurrent execution of Python code

This commit enables Python thread execution at some points to allow Python code
to inject data into the framework. For this, we

1. Check if Python headers and libraries are installed. If so, set HAVE_PYTHON.

2. Allow Python threads right before we launch the task threads.

3. Allow Python threads in ufo_input_task_get_input_buffer, because we could
block here before Python code inserted any data.
Do not include OpenCL headers in public UFO header
Use ufo build instead of system-wide installation

Fix execution in non-Python environments

The Python thread state can only be saved when we are actually running inside
something that looks like Python. Hence, we check first and save then.

Fix test execution problem on openSUSE

For some reason, locking across two calls was not working on openSUSE-based
systems. This change replaces the simple lock scheme with a condition-based
approach.

Revert "Add GLIB version guards"

This reverts commit c0c9fea52df5a0bf7a34805d1917747716c678cb.

Setting GLIB_VERSION_MAX_ALLOWED prevents building on machines with more recent
GLib versions for which GLIB_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED may than be lower than
GLIB_VERSION_MAX_ALLOWED. That is strictly forbidden by GLib itself.

As a workaround, the definition can and should be passed on the command line.

Add ufo-query binary to retrieve info about tasks

Add Bash completion script for ufo-launch

The completion script uses ufo-query to determine available plugins and their
respective property names.

The installation is opt-in for two reasons:

1. bash-completion allows completion only for scripts defined in
/usr/share/bash-completions/* or appended to ~/.bash_completions. The former is
not a viable solution if the user installs into his home directory (see 2.) and
the second is a logistic nightmare.

2. There is no straightforward way to ask CMake if an installation path is
writable at all or at least fail gracefully. Thus if the user is unable to
install outside his home directory, installation will fail badly.

Add simple fabfile to start ufod instances

Simplify retry_send_message

The order of arguments was throwing me off several times as well as the unused
customizability.
Prevent daemon from leaking OpenCL resources

Fix segfault with long-running tasks

This change sanitizes problems with long-running tasks. The sleep in the clean
up function was a crude hack to avoid unreffing objects before execution
stopped. This was not noticed with tasks that were faster than the arbitrary 1.5
seconds. Cleaning up after the scheduler actually finished solves this problem
and avoids the unnecessary wait time.

Annotate ufo_base_scheduler_set_resources

With GLib 2.40 unannotated methods are not exported automatically anymore.

Handle trace profiling in base scheduler

Before the tracing was scattered around the concrete scheduler classes or were
missing altogether.
Do not prepend . to trace and profile output
Use common timestamp unit for both trace types

Fix nano second to second conversion

... oh my god.

Fix reference leakage

When expanding the node, only the copies were marked for clean up. This change
also adds the originating nodes to the list of nodes that are unreferenced.

ufo-launch: fix parsing uint64

On certain architectures this was not working as expected.

Define OpenCL constants without value

This might break code but AFAIK the defines are not used within our own code
yet.

More extensive device name escaping

Intel's naming (e.g. Xeon (r) E5-XXX @ 3.7 GHz) is causing problems if defined
as a name.

Specify device subset with UFO_DEVICES

This fixes several problems with the previous UFO_USE_GPU environment variable.
First of all, it was renamed UFO_DEVICES to reflect all OpenCL devices. Second,
counting starts from zero like CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES. Most importantly, devices
can now be selected arbitrarily with a comma-separated list of indices just like
the NVIDIA variant.

Revert "Fix reference leakage"

This reverts commit 86653b1d59e017550a48a25faf136b7de5064a1e.

In a Python context the copies are accessed by the garbage collector and will
cause nasty messages.

Fix #103: allow ufo-launch to use arbitrary graphs

This change extends the format with bracketed arguments to other filters, i.e.
to specify that A and B are both inputs to task C, one can now run

  ufo-launch [A, B] ! C

The new parsing code also lifts some limitations such as required spaces and is
in principle a bit more robust.

Replace clprof with ufo-prof

Besides analyzing task traces next to OpenCL traces the new tool is also capable
to visualize the trace in a crude manner on the command line and outputs summary
information.

PIDs are not unique and are pretty difficult to make good use of in post
analysis.

ufo-launch: unref all task nodes

Although memory and resources are freed at the end of execution, we want to have
a clean teardown and ensure that disposed() and finalized() are called on each
task.

This is a purely informational and read-only property.
Fix invalid unref for single-node expansion paths
Properly reference tasks used as property

Fix #105: allow arbitrary strings with quotes

This fixes pipelines like

    ufo-launch read ! foo x="asd = 10" ! write

However, single quoting is required because Bash eats double quotes, i.e. we
need to specify the pipeline like

    ufo-launch read  ! foo x="'asd = 10'" ! write

otherwise the parser will mistake the quoted parts as part of the pipeline
specification.

This allows more flexible workflow descriptions like

     dummy-data, \
